The Dark Side of AI - Environmental & Social Costs Developers Must Know - Jutta Eckstein - ACCU 2025
---

What are the hidden environmental and social costs of artificial intelligence? In this thought-provoking lightning talk, software developer and author Jutta Eckstein dives into the dark side of AI-from energy and water consumption to algorithmic bias and global inequality. While AI is often celebrated for its innovation and convenience, this talk highlights the real-world consequences developers need to consider.

Jutta explains the staggering energy demand of AI models like GPT-3, which can consume the same electricity as 130 U.S. homes annually. The water usage for model training is equally alarming—up to 700,000 liters for a single training cycle. Through powerful examples, such as facial recognition bias uncovered by Joy Buolamwini, she shows how AI can automate discrimination and deepen social inequality.
